md:
giải nghĩa từ "balancing" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ đồng nghĩa.

* Balancing (verb) - Cân bằng, cân đối
	+ Meaning: To make something stable or steady by adjusting or counteracting the weight or force of something else.
	+ Example: The tightrope walker was balancing on the high wire.
	+ Related words: equilibrium, stability, poise
	+ Synonyms: stabilizing, counterbalancing, offsetting

* Balancing (noun) - Cân bằng, cân đối
	+ Meaning: The act of making something stable or steady by adjusting or counteracting the weight or force of something else.
	+ Example: The balancing of the budget was a major challenge for the government.
	+ Related words: equilibrium, stability, poise
	+ Synonyms: stabilization, counterbalance, offset

* Balancing (accounting) - Cân đối tài khoản
	+ Meaning: The process of ensuring that the debit and credit entries in a ledger or account are equal, so that the account is accurate and up-to-date.
	+ Example: The accountant spent hours balancing the company's books.
	+ Related words: ledger, account, debit, credit
	+ Synonyms: reconciling, adjusting, settling

* Balancing (gymnastics) - Cân bằng thể dục
	+ Meaning: The act of maintaining balance and control while performing a gymnastic routine or exercise.
	+ Example: The gymnast's balancing on the beam was impressive.
	+ Related words: gymnastics, balance, beam
	+ Synonyms: stabilizing, counterbalancing, poising
html:
giải nghĩa từ "balancing" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ đồng nghĩa.

  • Balancing (verb) - Cân bằng, cân đối

    • Meaning: To make something stable or steady by adjusting or counteracting the weight or force of something else.
    • Example: The tightrope walker was balancing on the high wire.
    • Related words: equilibrium, stability, poise
    • Synonyms: stabilizing, counterbalancing, offsetting

  • Balancing (noun) - Cân bằng, cân đối

    • Meaning: The act of making something stable or steady by adjusting or counteracting the weight or force of something else.
    • Example: The balancing of the budget was a major challenge for the government.
    • Related words: equilibrium, stability, poise
    • Synonyms: stabilization, counterbalance, offset

  • Balancing (accounting) - Cân đối tài khoản

    • Meaning: The process of ensuring that the debit and credit entries in a ledger or account are equal, so that the account is accurate and up-to-date.
    • Example: The accountant spent hours balancing the company's books.
    • Related words: ledger, account, debit, credit
    • Synonyms: reconciling, adjusting, settling

  • Balancing (gymnastics) - Cân bằng thể dục

    • Meaning: The act of maintaining balance and control while performing a gymnastic routine or exercise.
    • Example: The gymnast's balancing on the beam was impressive.
    • Related words: gymnastics, balance, beam
    • Synonyms: stabilizing, counterbalancing, poising
